channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Adaptive Behavior Cloning Regularization for Stable Offline-to-Online Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Offline reinforcement learning, by learning from a fixed dataset, makes it possible to learn agent behaviors without interacting with the environment.

item.title: GLIF: A Unified Gated Leaky Integrate-and-Fire Neuron for Spiking Neural Networks
item.description: In this paper, we propose GLIF, a unified spiking neuron, to fuse different bio-features in different neuronal behaviors, enlarging the representation space of spiking neurons.

item.title: Redistributor: Transforming Empirical Data Distributions
item.description: We present an algorithm and package, Redistributor, which forces a collection of scalar samples to follow a desired distribution.

item.title: A Spectral Method for Assessing and Combining Multiple Data Visualizations
item.description: Then it leverages the eigenscores to obtain a consensus visualization, which has much improved { quality over the individual visualizations in capturing the underlying true data structure.}

item.title: Synthetic Data Supervised Salient Object Detection
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel yet effective method for SOD, coined SODGAN, which can generate infinite high-quality image-mask pairs requiring only a few labeled data, and these synthesized pairs can replace the human-labeled DUTS-TR to train any off-the-shelf SOD model.

item.title: Instance Segmentation for Chinese Character Stroke Extraction, Datasets and Benchmarks
item.description: Moreover, there are no standardized benchmarks to provide a fair comparison between different stroke extraction methods, which, we believe, is a major impediment to the development of Chinese character stroke understanding and related tasks.

item.title: GlobalFlowNet: Video Stabilization using Deep Distilled Global Motion Estimates
item.description: However, in this work, we introduce a more general representation scheme, which adapts any existing optical flow network to ignore the moving objects and obtain a spatially smooth approximation of the global motion between video frames.

item.title: Pointly-Supervised Panoptic Segmentation
item.description: In this paper, we propose a new approach to applying point-level annotations for weakly-supervised panoptic segmentation.

item.title: Geo-SIC: Learning Deformable Geometric Shapes in Deep Image Classifiers
item.description: We introduce a newly designed framework that (i) simultaneously derives features from both image and latent shape spaces with large intra-class variations; and (ii) gains increased model interpretability by allowing direct access to the underlying geometric features of image data.

item.title: S3E: A Large-scale Multimodal Dataset for Collaborative SLAM
item.description: With the advanced request to employ a team of robots to perform a task collaboratively, the research community has become increasingly interested in collaborative simultaneous localization and mapping.

item.title: Local Color Distributions Prior for Image Enhancement
item.description: Existing image enhancement methods are typically designed to address either the over- or under-exposure problem in the input image.

item.title: DEMETR: Diagnosing Evaluation Metrics for Translation
item.description: While machine translation evaluation metrics based on string overlap (e. g., BLEU) have their limitations, their computations are transparent: the BLEU score assigned to a particular candidate translation can be traced back to the presence or absence of certain words.

item.title: Salient Object Detection via Dynamic Scale Routing
item.description: First, instead of using the vanilla convolution with fixed kernel sizes for the encoder design, we propose the dynamic pyramid convolution (DPConv), which dynamically selects the best-suited kernel sizes w. r. t.

item.title: MEW-UNet: Multi-axis representation learning in frequency domain for medical image segmentation
item.description: Specifically, our block performs a Fourier transform on the three axes of the input feature and assigns the external weight in the frequency domain, which is generated by our Weights Generator.

item.title: Contrastive Search Is What You Need For Neural Text Generation
item.description: Based on our findings, we further assess the contrastive search decoding method using off-the-shelf LMs on four generation tasks across 16 languages.

item.title: Unsupervised Anomaly Detection for Auditing Data and Impact of Categorical Encodings
item.description: As One Hot encoding of high cardinal dataset invokes the "curse of dimensionality", we experiment with GEL encoding and embedding layer for representing categorical attributes.

item.title: Learning to Reuse Distractors to support Multiple Choice Question Generation in Education
item.description: This paper studies how a large existing set of manually created answers and distractors for questions over a variety of domains, subjects, and languages can be leveraged to help teachers in creating new MCQs, by the smart reuse of existing distractors.

item.title: Information Filter upon Diversity-Improved Decoding for Diversity-Faithfulness Tradeoff in NLG
item.description: Some Natural Language Generation (NLG) tasks require both faithfulness and diversity.

item.title: EBEN: Extreme bandwidth extension network applied to speech signals captured with noise-resilient microphones
item.description: In this paper, we present Extreme Bandwidth Extension Network (EBEN), a generative adversarial network (GAN) that enhances audio measured with noise-resilient microphones.

item.title: Better Few-Shot Relation Extraction with Label Prompt Dropout
item.description: Our experiments show that our approach is able to lead to improved class representations, yielding significantly better results on the few-shot relation extraction task.

item.title: EBEN: Extreme Bandwidth Extension Network applied to speech signals captured with noise-resilient microphones
item.description: We present Extreme Bandwidth Extension Network (EBEN), a generative adversarial network (GAN) that enhances audio measured with noise-resilient microphones.

item.title: From Points to Functions: Infinite-dimensional Representations in Diffusion Models
item.description: Consequently, it is reasonable to ask if there is an intermediate time step at which the preserved information is optimal for a given downstream task.

item.title: PALT: Parameter-Lite Transfer of Language Models for Knowledge Graph Completion
item.description: For instance, we outperform the fully finetuning approaches on a KG completion benchmark by tuning only 1% of the parameters.

item.title: Help me write a poem: Instruction Tuning as a Vehicle for Collaborative Poetry Writing
item.description: The core component of our system is a language model fine-tuned on a diverse collection of instructions for poetry writing.

item.title: Multilingual Relation Classification via Efficient and Effective Prompting
item.description: Prompting pre-trained language models has achieved impressive performance on various NLP tasks, especially in low data regimes.

item.title: Exploring Mode Connectivity for Pre-trained Language Models
item.description: (3) How does the PLM's task knowledge change along the path connecting two minima?

item.title: Towards Interpretable Summary Evaluation via Allocation of Contextual Embeddings to Reference Text Topics
item.description: Despite extensive recent advances in summary generation models, evaluation of auto-generated summaries still widely relies on single-score systems insufficient for transparent assessment and in-depth qualitative analysis.

item.title: Eigen Memory Tree
item.description: This work introduces the Eigen Memory Tree (EMT), a novel online memory model for sequential learning scenarios.

item.title: Audio MFCC-gram Transformers for respiratory insufficiency detection in COVID-19
item.description: This work explores speech as a biomarker and investigates the detection of respiratory insufficiency (RI) by analyzing speech samples.

item.title: From exemplar to copy: the scribal appropriation of a Hadewijch manuscript computationally explored
item.description: This study is devoted to two of the oldest known manuscripts in which the oeuvre of the medieval mystical author Hadewijch has been preserved: Brussels, KBR, 2879-2880 (ms. A) and Brussels, KBR, 2877-2878 (ms. B).

item.title: Sequential Recommendation with Auxiliary Item Relationships via Multi-Relational Transformer
item.description: However, it remains a significant challenge to model auxiliary item relationships in SR. To simultaneously model high-order item-item transitions in sequences and auxiliary item relationships, we propose a Multi-relational Transformer capable of modeling auxiliary item relationships for SR (MT4SR).

item.title: Energy Pricing in P2P Energy Systems Using Reinforcement Learning
item.description: The microgrid considers consumers, prosumers, the service provider, and a community battery.

item.title: Adapters for Enhanced Modeling of Multilingual Knowledge and Text
item.description: Specifically, we introduce a lightweight adapter set to enhance MLLMs with cross-lingual entity alignment and facts from MLKGs for many languages.

item.title: Structural generalization is hard for sequence-to-sequence models
item.description: Sequence-to-sequence (seq2seq) models have been successful across many NLP tasks, including ones that require predicting linguistic structure.

item.title: Emergent World Representations: Exploring a Sequence Model Trained on a Synthetic Task
item.description: Language models show a surprising range of capabilities, but the source of their apparent competence is unclear.

item.title: Focused Concatenation for Context-Aware Neural Machine Translation
item.description: A straightforward approach to context-aware neural machine translation consists in feeding the standard encoder-decoder architecture with a window of consecutive sentences, formed by the current sentence and a number of sentences from its context concatenated to it.

item.title: Cascading Biases: Investigating the Effect of Heuristic Annotation Strategies on Data and Models
item.description: Cognitive psychologists have documented that humans use cognitive heuristics, or mental shortcuts, to make quick decisions while expending less effort.

item.title: Controlled Text Reduction
item.description: Producing a reduced version of a source text, as in generic or focused summarization, inherently involves two distinct subtasks: deciding on targeted content and generating a coherent text conveying it.

item.title: Does Joint Training Really Help Cascaded Speech Translation?
item.description: Currently, in speech translation, the straightforward approach - cascading a recognition system with a translation system - delivers state-of-the-art results.

item.title: Strong-TransCenter: Improved Multi-Object Tracking based on Transformers with Dense Representations
item.description: TransCenter is the first center-based transformer framework for MOT, and is also among the first to show the benefits of using transformer-based architectures for MOT.

item.title: ReaRev: Adaptive Reasoning for Question Answering over Knowledge Graphs
item.description: Our method, termed ReaRev, introduces a new way to KGQA reasoning with respect to both instruction decoding and execution.

item.title: EUR-Lex-Sum: A Multi- and Cross-lingual Dataset for Long-form Summarization in the Legal Domain
item.description: Existing summarization datasets come with two main drawbacks: (1) They tend to focus on overly exposed domains, such as news articles or wiki-like texts, and (2) are primarily monolingual, with few multilingual datasets.

item.title: Different Tunes Played with Equal Skill: Exploring a Unified Optimization Subspace for Delta Tuning
item.description: To fathom the mystery, we hypothesize that the adaptations of different DETs could all be reparameterized as low-dimensional optimizations in a unified optimization subspace, which could be found by jointly decomposing independent solutions of different DETs.

item.title: Structure-based Drug Design with Equivariant Diffusion Models
item.description: In this paper, we formulate SBDD as a 3D-conditional generation problem and present DiffSBDD, an E(3)-equivariant 3D-conditional diffusion model that generates novel ligands conditioned on protein pockets.

item.title: Evaluating Long-Term Memory in 3D Mazes
item.description: However, most benchmark tasks in reinforcement learning do not test long-term memory in agents, slowing down progress in this important research direction.

item.title: NVIDIA FLARE: Federated Learning from Simulation to Real-World
item.description: Federated learning (FL) enables building robust and generalizable AI models by leveraging diverse datasets from multiple collaborators without centralizing the data.

item.title: Monocular Dynamic View Synthesis: A Reality Check
item.description: We study the recent progress on dynamic view synthesis (DVS) from monocular video.

item.title: Graded-Q Reinforcement Learning with Information-Enhanced State Encoder for Hierarchical Collaborative Multi-Vehicle Pursuit
item.description: However, existing works on MVP pay little attention to the importance of information exchange and cooperation among pursuing vehicles under the complex urban traffic environment.

item.title: High-Resolution Image Editing via Multi-Stage Blended Diffusion
item.description: We first use Blended Diffusion to edit the image at a low resolution, and then upscale it in multiple stages, using a super-resolution model and Blended Diffusion.

item.title: Thermodynamics-informed neural networks for physically realistic mixed reality
item.description: The imminent impact of immersive technologies in society urges for active research in real-time and interactive physics simulation for virtual worlds to be realistic.
